page.title: 13History (Cont.)
page.content: The next certain fact about Kirkby-in-Furness is as a manor belonging to Furness Abbey-as did most parts of Furness. During the English Civil War, such was the isolation of the Furness Peninsula that it was not until the war reached Lancaster that people from the area became involved. In 1643, a Royalist army led by Lord Molyneux plundered Furness,but then returned to Lancaster. This raid encouraged Richard Kirkby,the eldest son of Roger Kirkby of Kirkby, to attempt to raise a force in support of the King. Although he seems to have had little success, he was joined by a Royalist regiment from Millom. They eventually met a Parliamentary force at Lindal-in-Furness, where they were easily routed after one cavalry charge by the Roundheads.
